title: AG to audit in-custody death cases during tenure of Dr. David Fowler
body: Testimony from Maryland's former chief medical examiner during the Derek Chauvin trial prompted the Maryland Attorney General's Office to launch an audit of in-custody deaths made by his office.Maryland Attorney General Brian Frosh said in a statement Friday that he is working with Gov. Larry Hogan's chief legal counsel to develop the timeline and process for an audit to examine all in-custody death determinations the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner's made during the tenure of Dr. David
